formalText: It is important to note that the patient is feeling badly more frequently than they are comfortable with and more frequently than they would help.
They know it's not time to symbolize depression yet, but they think they have what would be depression if it were happening consistently for 2 weeks.
They are feeling like water all the time.
She has unsettling thoughts about wanting to hurt herself,  non-fatally thoughts.
She feels like she is overacting to something small going on.
She feels irritable and anxious a lot, the anxious anxiety feels uncomfortable.
She is not crying non-stop.
She also felt it last week Sunday and Monday and Tuesday Wednesday and Thursday.
She was sing a little bit mad at work, but it wasn't such a big deal that she needed to leave earlier anything.
She felt good enough to be productive and dye the wall.
Her brain tells her that if she physically hurts herself it would feel better.
Eventually, it just goes away at the same time that the anxious uncomfortable feeling goes away.

Her antidepressants are working to some degree but she feels like they wore off. She doesn't know if she was on the end of them or if it's just that her depression only shows up some of the time and they're not doing anything.
Her room is chaotic, but it's not as chaotic as before.
So it's like she can sleep in it without it being an issue.
He did stay at her place for a few days that could have been why she was depressed on Sunday and Monday, but that's not why she is depressed now.

She feels like she should be applying for jobs again, but then she felt depressed again yesterday and today so she hasn't looked at one of the job sites. She found were going to work one that sounded really good was a temporary summer summer position and She didn't think she could take it.
So she was wondering how much of what she felt this past week is fueled by having her timeline laid out for her.
She got scared and feeling depressed because she did not like the job search process.

She didn't think any one of the things that happened in the environment or an event that or an event that happens causes feelings of depression, obviously anxiety and depression is something that she has struggled with off and on over the course of many years.

she was crying Non-Stop and it was this big feeling like sort of a cloud over her, but it was more of a physical feeling it.
